text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's store
podcast.com
you
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 69 in today's
episode I have a new idiom for you
Pennywise pound-foolish let's find out
what it means and how you can use it in
your daily conversation Pennywise and
pound-foolish
have you ever gone out of your way to
save a few bucks by making a compromise
and later landed up spending a huge
amount of money due to your foolishness
the idiom Pennywise and pound-foolish
basically means to save a little money
only to lose a greater amount later due
to your own foolishness a person who
makes a fuss over small amounts of money
to such an extent that he misses
opportunities to save or make large
amounts is called Pennywise and
pound-foolish it also means you are over
careful about unimportant in small
matters and careless about important
ones you realize that in the process of
being stingy about small expenditures
you eventually spend more than you
actually saved for example if you save a
few hundred bucks by not hiring a tax
accountant to review complicated account
matters you are penny wise and pound
foolish as you ultimately land up paying
a huge penalty amount okay now that you
know what this idiom means let's take a
look at some example sentences to see
how you can use it in your daily
conversation
example one a Pennywise and
pound-foolish Mike bought himself an
expensive tuxedo suit even though he
didn't need it but is still thinking
whether to buy a much-needed pair of
shoes example two Jennifer was Pennywise
and pound-foolish as she bought cheaper
vegetables at a wholesale price only to
be thrown as they were spoiled example 3
the manager realized he was Pennywise
and pound-foolish when he hired
undergraduates in order to save the
operating cost of the company example 4
Samantha told her friend neglecting your
cavities to save money will certainly
lead to a root canal which would be far
more expensive so don't be penny wise
and pound foolish example 5 sheila was
Pennywise and pound-foolish when she
made her husband drive to six different
stores to get the best bargains on her
groceries eventually she spent more on
fuel than the benefits she got example 6
being a handyman
William tried to fix the leaking faucet
and broke it he was Pennywise and
pound-foolish as he had to replace the
faucet pipe and pay the plumber as well
example seven
I sold my good motorcycle and purchased
a second-hand car that is giving me
endless problems it is too late to
realize that it was a penny wise and
pound foolish decision example eight the
government's education budget cuts part
Pennywise and pound-foolish as public
education is an investment towards the
nation's future
example 9 Mary told her husband we have
worked so hard to save money if we took
a vacation now it would be penny wise
and pound foolish that's the end of
today's episode have you ever done
something that made you realize that you
were penny wise and pound foolish kindly
share your experiences in the comment
box below this video thank you for
watching us do watch all the episodes of
daily video vocabulary to better your
English language skills do subscribe to
our Channel and stay updated with all
the latest lessons I will see you again
tomorrow with a new word or a phrase
till then bye and take care
